intro: Annona quinduensis, commonly known as the Guianese custard apple, is a tropical plant native to South America. It is a small to medium-sized tree that can grow up to 10 meters tall, with smooth, greyish-brown bark. The plant produces large, heart-shaped leaves that are typically 10–20 cm in length. Its flowers are white or pale yellow, with a strong fragrance, and it bears edible fruit that is similar in appearance to a mango. The fruit has a rough, green exterior and a sweet, creamy pulp with a mildly acidic taste.
